result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary R. Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary R. Harper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachary R. Harper was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Ct 7 in 14CF542.
Credit for 12 days, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include: Sex Offender Treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Pay DNA surcharge.
May not have contact with anyone under age 18.  DOC to determine contact w/ immediate family, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No access to any computer or internet w/o approval of agent.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney F Zievers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Mala Boyce interpreter for deft's family members.  Statements by:  Theresa H., Bonnie H. and Gertrude S.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions concurrent to ct 7 in 14CF542; pay $250 DNA surcharge; credit for 12 days served if revoked; bond applied to costs in this file, any remainder applied to restitution/costs in 13CF1055 and costs in 14CF542.

With Elizabeth/ADA Graveley and Diane/Atty Zievers the SEH of 11/7/14 at 11:30am is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 12/18/14 at 9:30am.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney F Zievers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  SEH set for 11/6/14 at 11am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Atty F Zievers appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  ADA Graveley states that Br 3 has consented to the case before him returning to this court.  Counsel is requesting to reschedule the sentencing to a new date to allow that case to catch up.  Court finds that the deft will have to withdraw the substitution he made on the Br 3 case before it can be heard here.  STC 9/26/14 at 9am; SEH to be reset after plea in the new case.  Bond continued.
